abstract: A notification that is posted when an accessory is disconnected and no longer available for your application to use.
overview:
## Discussion

The notification object is the shared accessory manager. The `userInfo` dictionary contains an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessoryKey], whose value is the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessory] object representing the accessory that was disconnected. Before delivery of this notification can occur, you must call the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessoryManager/registerForLocalNotifications()] method to let the system know you are interested in receiving this notification.

If your accessory manager has a delegate, the delegate can use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessoryDelegate/accessoryDidDisconnect(_:)] method to receive this notification instead.

# EAAccessoryDidDisconnect

**Type Property**

A notification that is posted when an accessory is disconnected and no longer available for your application to use.

## Declaration

```swift
static let EAAccessoryDidDisconnect: NSNotification.Name
```

## Discussion

The notification object is the shared accessory manager. The `userInfo` dictionary contains an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessoryKey], whose value is the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessory] object representing the accessory that was disconnected. Before delivery of this notification can occur, you must call the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessoryManager/registerForLocalNotifications()] method to let the system know you are interested in receiving this notification.

If your accessory manager has a delegate, the delegate can use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ExternalAccessory/EAAccessoryDelegate/accessoryDidDisconnect(_:)] method to receive this notification instead.

## External Accessory

- **EAAccessoryDidConnect**: A notification that the system sends when an accessory becomes connected and available for your application to use.
